OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and manage a patient presenting with vulvar itching and discomfort.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a year-long history of severe vulvar itching and pain during sexual intercourse that has gradually worsened. She has tried over-the-counter lubricants without significant relief. Menopause occurred 8 years ago. Her medical history is significant for diet-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus and hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide.
Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Type 2 diabetes mellitus (diet-controlled), hypertension (treated with hydrochlorothiazide), menopause at 52 years of age.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Married, sexually active with her husband until recently due to severe pain. Non-smoker, drinks alcohol socially.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies urinary incontinence, postcoital bleeding, or recent changes in skin elsewhere on the body.

Gynecologic_Examination.External_Genitalia: Dry, thin, white plaque-like lesions on the vulva. Atrophy of the labia minora and retraction of the clitoris. Pale and wrinkled perianal skin.
Gynecologic_Examination.Speculum_Examination: No vaginal discharge or bleeding. Vaginal mucosa appears atrophic.
Gynecologic_Examination.Bimanual_Examination: Nontender uterus and adnexa. No masses palpated.

Pap_Smear.Findings: Negative for intraepithelial lesion or malignancy

Biopsy_of_Vulvar_Lesions.Histopathology: Hyperkeratosis with a thinning of the epidermis and loss of rete ridges, sclerotic changes in the dermis.

Blood_Glucose.Fasting_Glucose_Level: 6.5 mmol/L (117 mg/dL) - Indicative of controlled diabetes.

OSCE_Examination.Objective_for_Doctor: Evaluate and diagnose the patient presenting with chronic vulvar itching and discomfort.

Patient_Actor.History: The patient presents with a complaint of severe vulvar itching that has been gradually worsening over the course of the past year. She has attempted to use over-the-counter lubricants for relief with no substantial improvement. She reports severe pain during vaginal intercourse that has recently led to cessation of sexual activity.

Secondary_Symptoms: Use of over-the-counter lubricants with no relief

Patient_Actor.Past_Medical_History: Diet-controlled type 2 diabetes mellitus, hypertension treated with hydrochlorothiazide, menopause occurred at 52 years of age.
Patient_Actor.Social_History: Sexually active with her husband until recently due to discomfort.
Patient_Actor.Review_of_Systems: Denies urinary symptoms, abnormal vaginal discharge, or rectal symptoms.

Genitourinary_Examination.Inspection: Dry, thin, white plaque-like lesions in the vulvar area, with atrophy of the labia minora. The clitoris appears retracted. The perianal skin is pale and wrinkled.
Genitourinary_Examination.Palpation: The lesions are palpable and the vulvar area is tender to touch.

Vulvar_Biopsy.Findings: Hyperkeratosis with thinning of the epidermis and sclerosis of the dermis, confirming lichen sclerosus.
